name: timelines tee
notes:
**pattern is available for free here : [biscotte.org/timeline-tee][1]**
========================================

timelines explain what happened during a certain period of time or something that happened to a particular person, starting with the earliest event and moving forward through time. your timeline may have ended but i will continue to carry your memory all throughout mine. - andrea yetman
----------------------------------------


**yarn**
collection louise robert design - super sock – 75% merino and 25% nylon - 400m/437yds

sample uses:
imperatrice 1 (1, 1, 2, 2, 2, 2, 3) skein
canevas 1 (1, 1, 2, 2, 2, 2, 3) skein
chopin 1 (1, 1, 2, 2, 2, 2, 3) skein

**needles**
3.75mm (us#6)– circulars of at least 22” (56cm) & dpn’s(or size needed to obtain gauge).

**notions**
stitch holderor scrap yarn
stitch markers
tapestry needle
2 buttons (optional)
gauge - 24sts and 32 rows = 4”; 10cm on stockinette stitch

**sizes** - xs (s, m, l, xl, xxl, 3xl, 4xl)

finished bust circumference – 33 (35, 37, 38.5, 40, 41.5, 44, 46) inches – 84 (89, 94, 98, 101.5, 104, 112, 117) cm. meant to be worn with 2 inches – 5 cm of positive ease.

**pattern notes**

this tee is knit flat to shape the neckline while increasing at the raglan seams. then the body is joined to knit in the round and continuing to increase. after separating the sleeves and body, the sleeve stitches are placed on hold and the body is knit even in stockinette stitch.

the bottom portion is detailed with a couple of seed stitch bands for a modern look. the sleeves are picked up and knit in the round, binding off without any ribbing. the intention is that the sleeves will roll, and a little button is added at the top of the sleeve for decoration only. if you prefer not to have a rolled sleeve with button, a ribbing of your choice can be added.

keep in mind if you would like to add a seed stitch border to the sleeve to match the bottom, decrease 1 st before beginning as seed stitch in the round requires an odd number of stitches. the neckline is left without any finishing touches, however there is an option to add a minimal neckline if desired. the sample was knit using 60 rnds per color, you can choose to change color as you wish, or even knit it in a solid color! this is a blank canvas to have fun with!!

la version française de ce patron se trouve sur [leslainesbiscotte.com][2] 


  [1]: https://biscotte.org/timelines-tee
  [2]: https://biscotte.org/timelines-tee
